metadata.title: Week 1 Day 4: Latin Alphabet and Basic Vocabulary

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should be familiar with the basic sounds of the Latin alphabet and have a preliminary understanding of how these sounds correspond to written letters. They should have been introduced to basic Latin vocabulary related to classroom objects and greetings, such as 'liber' for book and 'salve' for hello. The concept of discipline as a virtue in learning languages should also be familiar, as well as the significance of the faith phrase 'In principio'.
yesterday_recap: Yesterday, students practiced the Latin alphabet and began associating sounds with written letters. They also learned basic vocabulary related to classroom objects.

primary: Students will recite the Latin alphabet with correct pronunciation.
Students will identify and pronounce basic Latin vocabulary related to classroom objects.
Students will translate the faith phrase 'In principio' and discuss its significance.
spiral_review: Review the pronunciation of the Latin alphabet.
Reinforce vocabulary related to classroom objects.

lesson_flow.description: Review the Latin alphabet and pronunciation from previous lessons.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students recite the alphabet and correct pronunciation errors.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Focus on sounds that are commonly mispronounced.

lesson_flow.description: Quick review of vocabulary related to classroom objects.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students match vocabulary words with images of classroom objects.

lesson_flow.description: Practice pronunciation of new vocabulary words introduced this week.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students repeat after the teacher and practice in pairs.

lesson_flow.description: Discuss the faith phrase 'In principio' and its significance.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students reflect on the phrase and share thoughts.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Connect the phrase to the virtue of discipline.

lesson_flow.description: Oral quiz on the Latin alphabet and vocabulary.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students recite the alphabet and translate vocabulary words.

lesson_flow.description: Summarize the day's learning and set expectations for the next lesson.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students share one new thing they learned.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to practice at home.
